alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 2:00PM CST until March 04 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Roubidoux Creek Near Waynesville affecting Pulaski County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood -East Gate affecting Pulaski County. Gasconade River at Jerome affecting Phelps County. .Heavy rainfall received last night and today will cause the rivers to rise above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roubidoux Creek near Waynesville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the RV Park on the west side of Roubidoux in Waynesville just north of the Business 66 bridge floods. Spring Road near I-44 floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CST Friday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
